title: Vanity Fair - example of narrator's irony

content.question: Which of the following descriptions from the first part of paragraph 1 is an example of the narrator's irony?

choices.label: "he was unluckily endowed with a good name" (paragraph 1 sentence 2)
"grudge almost the seed to the ground" (paragraph 1 sentence 4)
"He speculated in every possible way" (paragraph 1 sentence 5)

content.answer: "he was unluckily endowed with a good name" (paragraph 1 sentence 2)

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
